name: Red Lion Hotel Bend

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I was disappointed with this property.
reviews.title: This is a 2 star motel, not a 3 star hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Although the units are a reasonable size the 2 queen beds and the enormous wardrobe affair filled almost all the space. The only way to watch tv was from the beds as it could not be seen from the tiny sitting space.
reviews.title: Nice place

reviews.text: The beds are soft but linens OK.
reviews.title: Little pricy

reviews.text: Breakfast was basic and supplies were not regularly replenished. As others have noted, seating in this area is scant.
reviews.title: Very nice rooms. Great breakfast.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: If all you want is a bed and a coffee this would probably fit the bill at the right price.
reviews.title: Everything was perfect, except...

reviews.text: Don't miss St Francis's Mc Mennamens great brew pub,food was very enjoyable ,ate there twice!! Try the Ruby beer :-) Lots of thrift store shopping in Bend,outlets,Trader Joes,World market,obviously I shopped when hubby was in a conference !!
reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Red Lion in Bend is older and has not kept up with the latest in decorating accessories. But if you are looking for a comfortable, clean room when skiing at Mt Bachelor, this hotel works just fine. You can get to most of everything that Bend offers and a few minutes. The breakfast is basic but good. Bend is a great place to visit any season of the year, and this hotel works great if you are not planning on spending most of your time in your room.
reviews.title: Sometimes older is just fine

reviews.text: Stayed here to visit family. Star rating seemed high for it actually is. Exterior is outdated and worn, but inside has been upgraded. Pet policy is good and people were nice. Probably would not stay again, but might return if no other options. Feels like a low budget motel.
reviews.title: Feels low budget and low quality. Room and people were nice.

reviews.text: The Red Lion Hotel is centrally located and close to majority of the local activities. They are a dog friendly hotel which is a plus in our books. The rooms were nicely decorated but just a little to narrow. The oversized credenza that held the TV, dresser drawers, and closet all in one unit was way to big for the room. Made it really hard to pass between the bed and credenza without running into the doors that swung outward. The bathroom was "shower only"... so if you are looking to soak in the tub then your out of luck. The hotel was totally booked but I never once heard another soul. The rooms were extremely quiet!!! The breakfast room was quite small and we were lucky enough to find a table, but noticed several couples coming in and taking their food back to their rooms. They did offer a very nice breakfast of eggs, bacon, sausage and hashbrowns. Toast, fruit, cereal etc... pretty much everything to fill up for the morning. Overall I would probably stay here again.
reviews.title: Nice accommodations, but a tight squeeze...

reviews.text: I stayed there last week and found it average at best..only because staff was so great. The hotel does not have an elevator so if you are handicapped or otherwise cannot lug a suitcase up a flight of stairs..forget it...great location..good breakfast..ok rooms..older and sort of smelly..stale smelling ? clean though..
reviews.title: Giving it 3 stars only because of staff

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It's hard to find a decent motel in Bend for under $100/night. By booking ahead we got a decent rate and I think you can find similar rates on Priceline and Expedia (though maybe not in high season). The room was fine with updated bath and vanity. Plus: Nice bed linens (double sheeted), quality towels, good bath products, satisfactory Wifi, ok pool area, adequate complimentary breakfast. Minus: Property not aesthetically pleasing (though we could view Pilot Butte from our 2nd floor room), room a little tight, motel-like feel with exterior doors and though it was 'surface clean' I felt better after wiping handles, light switches, remote, etc. with a lysol wipe. If you want to save $$, just need a place to sleep then this should be fine for you (it was quiet at night). Don't expect it to be a three star property. If you like swankier looks, premium TV channels, flat screens, newness and access to attractive public space don't stay here. We went to Bend for bicycling, hiking and brew pubs, so weren't in the room much. The location on a busy road with no bike lanes prompted us to figure out a way to access roads with bike lanes--go out the side of the property to Olney and work your way out.
reviews.title: Decent Value

reviews.text: Jasper at the front desk provided exceptional service from the minute I walked in the door. She was friendly and extremely helpful. The room was very clean and nicely updated with all the amenities. Honestly, I was surprised by the whole experience. I would highly recommend this Red Lion for its value and the service I received.
reviews.title: Customer Service was Exceptional!

reviews.text: I booked the Red Lion thru Priceline's "Express Deal" option, where you don't know the name of the hotel before you pay--you only know the star rating. I was pleasantly surprised by the Red Lion. While the location isn't particularly picturesque, the staff is really helpful and pleasant, the rooms are clean and well appointed, and the beds are very comfortable. While some of the furniture is dated, everything is well taken care of, and clean.
reviews.title: Very, very comfortable

reviews.text: While the receptionist said they have a small exercise room, they also have memberships at the fitness club across the street, where I was able to get in a pretty good workout. They have free coffee, tea, cookies and fruit at any time of day, and a decent breakfast in the morning.
reviews.title: Worst service. Horribly harassed by security guards. Won't ever come back. Air conditioning doesn't work

reviews.text: Although we only stayed overnight--if you're looking for convenience, comfort and cleanliness, the Red Lion is a pretty good bet.
reviews.title: Not a three-star hotel - nope, no way!

reviews.text: Great location close to everything at a great price. I was greated by a happy friendly staff that started my visit off perfect. Clean, quiet and no complaints. The breakfast is good but I sure wish they had a waffle maker.
reviews.title: Great location, great price, and even greater service.

reviews.text: This Red Lion is about what you might expect for a hotel in terms of rooms and facilities - but the service here made me feel like I got a great value. Everything was very clean, there were hot drinks and cookies in the lobby when I checked in, the staff was very helpful and went out of their way to make me feel welcome. The breakfast was good too - I'm not a big breakfast person but there was good coffee, nice Tazo teas and fresh pineapple! I'm definitely coming back the next time I need a place to stay in Bend.
reviews.title: Nice stay

reviews.text: Business trip to Bend and a very nice experience compared to one a few weeks earlier. Stayed at The Riverhouse for $30 more a night and it was nowhere as clean and nice as the Red Lion. Don't let the 70s exterior scare you away. The room was new, clean, and huge. Front desk was super friendly and helpful. Breakfast was pretty standard motel fare but I only had time once to try it. Perfect location for me, too, near the hospital where I was working. It's on the highway but the room was very quiet.
reviews.title: Nice stay at Red Lion

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2012, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Stayed here one night in summer as part of a tour around the US. Typical motel style property, plentiful parking, rooms exactly as you would expect and quite spacious if a little musty. Pleasant lobby area with fire where you could sit and read and although we got there too late it looked like they put out some cookies at the front desk and tea/coffee available free in the lobby. Not a lot in Bend itself but we were staying before a visit to the volcanic areas closeby which were really impressive. Does exactly what it says on the tin - breakfast room very busy in the morning though, we took ours back to the room rather than brave the scrum!
reviews.title: Typical Motel

reviews.text: What a delight. EVERYTHING worked; nothing broken. The staff at breakfast were attentive. Granted, it is a mid-priced hotel but a very comfortable experience. I thought having to walk across the parking lot to a restaurant called the Black Bear couldn't end well. It was delightful and a real bargain. Likewise, some pet-friendly hotels are anything but. My Westie and I were both made to feel very welcome by all.
reviews.title: Red Lion Bend is good value

description: The Red Lion Hotel Bend OR is centrally located in the heart of downtown Bend on Business 97. Nearby, you will find 28 golf courses, the High Desert Museum, Deschutes County Expo Center and historic downtown. Outdoor enthusiasts will enjoy the area's hundreds of miles of bike and hiking trails, rivers, lakes, Mt. Bachelor Ski Resort and numerous state parks.For your convenience, our 75 non-smoking guest rooms are equipped with amenities that include Red Lion's signature Sealy pillowtop beds, Eco Fresh Environmentally Responsible Products (ERP), free wi-fi, refrigerator, microwave and coffeemaker. We also feature a seasonal, outdoor pool, whirlpool and fitness center. We offer Red Lion's signature Roaring Start Breakfast Buffet included in your rate. The whole family will enjoy dining at our Black Bear Diner for breakfast, lunch and dinner. On-site, we also offer 2,000 square feet of meeting space for board meetings, family gatherings, seminars or corporate meetings of 10 to 50 people. Room service is also available through Black Bear Diner.For additional dining choices, Bend boasts over 275 restaurants and brew pubs, many of which are within a 3-block radius of the hotel.
